treatment.taxon_hierarchy: family Asteraceae;tribe Cichorieae;genus Crepis;species runcinata;subspecies andersonii;
treatment.description: Plants 25–50 cm. Leaves: petioles broadly winged; blades oblance-olate, 2–3 cm wide, margins strongly and coarsely serrate or toothed (teeth prominently white-tipped), faces glabrous or hispidulous. Heads 6–20. Involucres 19–21 mm. Phyllaries broadly lanceolate, apices long-acuminate, faces usually stipitate-glandular. Cypselae pale yellow to reddish brown, 6–8 mm, ± distinctly beaked; pappi 6–9 mm. 2n = 22.

habitat_info.text: alkaline seeps , grasslands , moist alkaline valley bottoms ;

treatment.discussion: Subspecies andersonii is identified mainly by the relatively large involucres with densely stipitate-glandular phyllaries and the leaf margins with sharp, prominently white-tipped teeth.
